intro: Leonia dichotoma, commonly known as the forked leonia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive forked stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Leonia dichotoma is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
